title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 380-2.8 - Fifty-two consecutive weeks
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 380-2.8 - Fifty-two consecutive weeks

State Regulations

Fifty-two consecutive weeks shall be computed
retroactively with respect to each day for which benefits are currently being
claimed. In no case shall a single claim for periodic family leave cover more
than fifty-two weeks, an employee with an eligible periodic claim must submit a
new claim at the end of the fifty-two week period. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
380-2.8

Adopted

New

York State Register July 19, 2017/Volume XXXIX, Issue 29, eff. 7/19/2017

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
